title: Create GitHub Actions workflow
description:
Create GitHub Actions workflow that polls for new Codex releases every 15 minutes.

**File:** `.github/workflows/check-release.yml`

**Full workflow:**
```yaml
name: Check Codex Release

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '*/15 * * * *'  # Every 15 minutes
  workflow_dispatch:        # Manual trigger

jobs:
  check-and-post:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write       # Needed to push state file

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          cache: 'npm'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci

      - name: Check for new release and post
        env:
          TWITTER_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.TWITTER_API_KEY }}
          TWITTER_API_SECRET: ${{ secrets.TWITTER_API_SECRET }}
          TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN }}
          TWITTER_ACCESS_SECRET: ${{ secrets.TWITTER_ACCESS_SECRET }}
        run: npx tsx src/index.ts

      - name: Commit updated state
        run: |
          git config user.name 'github-actions[bot]'
          git config user.email 'github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com'
          git add data/last-posted-version.txt
          git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m 'Update last-posted version'
          git push
```

**Key points:**
- `permissions: contents: write` required for pushing
- `git diff --staged --quiet ||` prevents empty commits
- Secrets injected via env vars

**Verification:**
1. Push workflow to GitHub
2. Go to Actions tab â†’ 'Check Codex Release'
3. Click 'Run workflow' (manual trigger)
4. Verify it completes successfully

**Acceptance criteria:**
- [ ] Workflow file valid YAML
- [ ] Manual trigger works
- [ ] Secrets accessible in job

title: Implement release notes parser
description:

**Interface:**
```typescript
export interface ParsedFeatures {
  features: string[];  // Clean feature descriptions
  raw: string;         // Original markdown section
}

export function parseNewFeatures(releaseBody: string): ParsedFeatures
```

**Implementation notes:**

- Clean each feature:

  - Trim whitespace
- Return empty array if section not found (not an error)

6. Handles nested content (should only get top-level bullets)

**Real test data (from v0.92.0):**

title: Implement GitHub release fetcher
description:
Create module to fetch latest stable Codex release from GitHub API.

**File:** `src/github.ts`

**Interface:**
```typescript
export interface Release {
  version: string;      // e.g., '0.92.0'
  tagName: string;      // e.g., 'rust-v0.92.0'
  body: string;         // Full release notes markdown
  url: string;          // GitHub release URL
  publishedAt: string;  // ISO date string
}

export async function getLatestStableRelease(): Promise<Release | null>
```

**Implementation notes:**
- Use `@octokit/rest` (no auth needed for public repos)
- Fetch with `per_page: 10` to get recent releases
- Filter: exclude tags containing 'alpha', 'beta', 'rc'
- Version extraction: `tag.replace('rust-v', '')`
- Return `null` if no stable release found

2. Skips alpha/beta/rc releases correctly

title: Configure GitHub Secrets
description:
MANUAL TASK - Add Twitter credentials to GitHub repository secrets.

**Prerequisites:**
- GitHub repository created and pushed
- Twitter credentials from codex-changelog-600

**Steps:**
1. Create GitHub repo if not exists:
   ```bash
   gh repo create codex-changelog --public --source=. --push
   ```

2. Add secrets via CLI (recommended):
   ```bash
   gh secret set TWITTER_API_KEY
   gh secret set TWITTER_API_SECRET
   gh secret set TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN
   gh secret set TWITTER_ACCESS_SECRET
   ```
   (Each command prompts for the value securely)

   OR via GitHub UI:
   - Go to repo â†’ Settings â†’ Secrets and variables â†’ Actions
   - Click 'New repository secret' for each

**Verification:**
```bash
gh secret list
# Should show all 4 secrets (values hidden)
```

**Acceptance criteria:**
- [ ] Repository exists on GitHub
- [ ] All 4 secrets configured
- [ ] `gh secret list` shows them
